name: Virgen del Cobre, Digital Draw, 2020
description: Oshún, as she is known in the Yoruba religion or Cachita, as we call her in Cuba, has its origins in 1612. According to Juan Moreno, he and his brothers were in a canoe looking for salt when they saw something blooming in the sea. As they approached, they realized it was an image of the Virgin Mary on a board that read: "I am the Virgin of Charity". The little ones were slaves and worked in the copper mines of the region. Dedicate 5 sunflowers and place a glass of water in her honor.
